alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 5:14PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... Strong northwesterly winds of up to 50 mph across the southern coast of the Alaska Peninsula and Shelikof Strait will continue through Wednesday evening. These winds will resuspend ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted. Those with respiratory ailments in these areas are encouraged to avoid or reduce outdoor activity to avoid inhaling the ash. The winds are expected to diminish and shift to the west-southwest by Wednesday evening, which would allow any lingering ash to move away from Kodiak Island and settle out of the atmosphere.
